title: 2021 Ford GT 66 Heritage Edition
description: This 2021 Ford GT is a ’66 Heritage Edition example built in commemoration of the 55th anniversary of Ford’s first 24-hour endurance win at Daytona 24 Hour Continental. It is finished in Frozen White with black and red graphics over red Alcantara, and power is provided by a twin-turbocharged 3.5-liter EcoBoost V6 paired with a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. Equipment includes 20″ forged aluminum wheels, Brembo carbon-ceramic brakes, an Akrapovič titanium exhaust system, butterfly doors, a retractable active rear wing, a rear diffuser, carbon-fiber exterior trim, automatic climate control, a touchscreen infotainment system, and fixed Sparco seats with six-point racing harness anchors. Purchased new by the owner, this Ford GT has 4,200 miles and is now offered on dealer consignment with the ordering kit, a window sticker, the owner's manual, service records, spare parts, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Illinois title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 2021 Ford GT 66 Heritage Edition at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #189,769.
text: This 2021 Ford GT is a ’66 Heritage Edition example built in commemoration of the 55th anniversary of Ford’s first 24-hour endurance win at Daytona 24 Hour Continental. It is finished in Frozen White with black and red graphics over red Alcantara, and power is provided by a twin-turbocharged 3.5-liter EcoBoost V6 paired with a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. Equipment includes 20″ forged aluminum wheels, Brembo carbon-ceramic brakes, an Akrapovič titanium exhaust system, butterfly doors, a retractable active rear wing, a rear diffuser, carbon-fiber exterior trim, automatic climate control, a touchscreen infotainment system, and fixed Sparco seats with six-point racing harness anchors. Purchased new by the owner, this Ford GT has 4,200 miles and is now offered on dealer consignment with the ordering kit, a window sticker, the owner’s manual, service records, spare parts, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Illinois title. The Chris Svensson-designed second-generation GT debuted at the 2015 North American International Auto Show and entered production in December 2016 at Multimatic’s Markham, Ontario, assembly facility. This example is finished Frozen White with black and red ’66 Heritage Edition graphics. Additional details include LED headlights, a lightweight Gorilla Glass windshield, butterfly doors, a retractable active rear wing, LED taillights, a rear diffuser, and carbon-fiber exterior trim. Paint protection film has been applied to the exterior, per the seller. The GT features a carbon-fiber monocoque structure bolted to front and rear aluminum subframes that serve as stressed members for the hydraulically adjustable pushrod suspension system. Variable ride height, front-axle lift system, selectable driving modes, and launch control are standard features. Staggered-width 20″ forged aluminum wheels are mounted with Michelin tires. Braking is handled by red-painted Brembo six-piston monoblock calipers over 15.5” carbon-ceramic discs up front, while four-piston calipers are mounted over 14.1” units out back. The cabin features red Alcantara over the fixed Sparco seats, which have manually reclining carbon-fiber shells. Exposed carbon fiber is visible on the door sills, dashboard, center console, and door panels. The fixed-position driver seat is paired with an adjustable pedal box and steering column, and the car is equipped with six-point racing harness anchors. Additional equipment includes automatic climate control and a touchscreen infotainment system. The Alcantara-wrapped multi-function steering wheel fronts paddle shifters and a configurable digital instrument panel. The digital odometer indicates 4,200 miles, all of which were added during current ownership. The mid-mounted twin-turbocharged 3.5L EcoBoost V6 features a carbon-fiber engine cover and an Akrapovič titanium exhaust system.  Factory-rated output was 660 horsepower and 550 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels via a Getrag seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. Carbon-fiber aero panels are fitted fore and aft. The window sticker lists initial delivery to Pat Milliken Ford of Redford Township, Michigan, along with factory colors, equipment, options, and a total MSRP of $717,850. The owner’s manual, a battery tender, the ordering kit, production photos, and spare parts are included in the sale. The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage. There is currently a lien out on the car, and the owner’s lender will need to be paid off before the title can be transferred to the new owner. You are not connected to real-time updates. html:
This 2021 Ford GT is a ’66 Heritage Edition example built in commemoration of the 55th anniversary of Ford’s first 24-hour endurance win at Daytona 24 Hour Continental. It is finished in Frozen White with black and red graphics over red Alcantara, and power is provided by a twin-turbocharged 3.5-liter EcoBoost V6 paired with a seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. Equipment includes 20″ forged aluminum wheels, Brembo carbon-ceramic brakes, an Akrapovič titanium exhaust system, butterfly doors, a retractable active rear wing, a rear diffuser, carbon-fiber exterior trim, automatic climate control, a touchscreen infotainment system, and fixed Sparco seats with six-point racing harness anchors. Purchased new by the owner, this Ford GT has 4,200 miles and is now offered on dealer consignment with the ordering kit, a window sticker, the owner’s manual, service records, spare parts, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Illinois title.

The Chris Svensson-designed second-generation GT debuted at the 2015 North American International Auto Show and entered production in December 2016 at Multimatic’s Markham, Ontario, assembly facility. This example is finished Frozen White with black and red ’66 Heritage Edition graphics. Additional details include LED headlights, a lightweight Gorilla Glass windshield, butterfly doors, a retractable active rear wing, LED taillights, a rear diffuser, and carbon-fiber exterior trim. Paint protection film has been applied to the exterior, per the seller.

The GT features a carbon-fiber monocoque structure bolted to front and rear aluminum subframes that serve as stressed members for the hydraulically adjustable pushrod suspension system. Variable ride height, front-axle lift system, selectable driving modes, and launch control are standard features.

Staggered-width 20″ forged aluminum wheels are mounted with Michelin tires. Braking is handled by red-painted Brembo six-piston monoblock calipers over 15.5” carbon-ceramic discs up front, while four-piston calipers are mounted over 14.1” units out back.

The cabin features red Alcantara over the fixed Sparco seats, which have manually reclining carbon-fiber shells. Exposed carbon fiber is visible on the door sills, dashboard, center console, and door panels. The fixed-position driver seat is paired with an adjustable pedal box and steering column, and the car is equipped with six-point racing harness anchors. Additional equipment includes automatic climate control and a touchscreen infotainment system.

The Alcantara-wrapped multi-function steering wheel fronts paddle shifters and a configurable digital instrument panel. The digital odometer indicates 4,200 miles, all of which were added during current ownership.

The mid-mounted twin-turbocharged 3.5L EcoBoost V6 features a carbon-fiber engine cover and an Akrapovič titanium exhaust system.  Factory-rated output was 660 horsepower and 550 lb-ft of torque.

Power is sent to the rear wheels via a Getrag seven-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. Carbon-fiber aero panels are fitted fore and aft.

The window sticker lists initial delivery to Pat Milliken Ford of Redford Township, Michigan, along with factory colors, equipment, options, and a total MSRP of $717,850.

The owner’s manual, a battery tender, the ordering kit, production photos, and spare parts are included in the sale.

The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.

There is currently a lien out on the car, and the owner’s lender will need to be paid off before the title can be transferred to the new owner.
